snippet: Since extreme cuts in 2011, shootings are up 48 percent and rapes, robberies, aggravated assaults, burglaries and motor vehicle thefts have also increased, though in smaller increments.
abstract: Crime has increased in Sacramento, Calif, since extreme cuts to police force in 2011; shootings are up 48 percent and other crimes have also increased, though in smaller increments; department has lost more than 300 officers and civilian staff and more than 30 percent of budget since 2008.
lead_paragraph: Since extreme cuts in 2011, shootings are up 48 percent and rapes, robberies, aggravated assaults, burglaries and motor vehicle thefts have also increased, though in smaller increments.

headline.seo: After Deep Police Cuts, Sacramento Sees Rise in Crime
headline.main: Crime Increases in Sacramento After Deep Cuts to Police Force
headline.print_headline: Crime Increases in Sacramento After Deep Cuts to Police Force
